What is the purpose of the `importprivkey` command in Verus?

The `importprivkey` command is used to add a private key to your wallet. This command takes three arguments: the private key itself, an optional label, and a boolean flag to specify whether to rescan the wallet for transactions.

importprivkey "verusprivkey" ( "label" rescan ) Adds a private key (as returned by dumpprivkey) to your wallet. Arguments: 1. "verusprivkey"  (string, required) The private key (see dumpprivkey) 2. "label"      (string, optional, default="") An optional label 3. rescan        (boolean, optional, default=true) Rescan the wallet for transactions Note: This call can take minutes to complete if rescan is true. Examples: Dump a private key > verus dumpprivkey "myaddress" Import the private key with rescan > verus importprivkey "mykey" Import using a label and without rescan > verus importprivkey "mykey" "testing" false As a JSON-RPC call > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "importprivkey", "params": ["mykey", "testing", false] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

What are the arguments required for the `importprivkey` command?

The `importprivkey` command requires at least one argument, which is the private key (as returned by `dumpprivkey`). The other two arguments, "label" and "rescan", are optional. "Label" is used to assign a label to the private key, and "rescan" is a boolean flag that specifies whether to rescan the wallet for transactions.

"label"      (string, optional, default="") An optional label 3. rescan        (boolean, optional, default=true) Rescan the wallet for transactions Note: This call can take minutes to complete if rescan is true. What is the default value of the "rescan" argument in the `importprivkey` command?
The default value of the "rescan" argument in the `importprivkey` command is `true`. This means that if you don't specify a value for "rescan", the wallet will be rescanned for transactions.

importprivkey "verusprivkey" ( "label" rescan ) Adds a private key (as returned by dumpprivkey) to your wallet. Arguments: 1. "verusprivkey"  (string, required) The private key (see dumpprivkey) 2. "label"      (string, optional, default="") An optional label 3. rescan        (boolean, optional, default=true) Rescan the wallet for transactions Note: This call can take minutes to complete if rescan is true. How long can the `importprivkey` command take to complete if "rescan" is set to `true`?
If "rescan" is set to `true`, the `importprivkey` command can take minutes to complete. This is because the wallet needs to rescan for transactions, which can be a time-consuming process.

How can I import a private key using a label and without rescanning the wallet?

You can import a private key using a label and without rescanning the wallet by specifying the label and setting "rescan" to `false`. For example:
```
verus importprivkey "mykey" "testing" false
```
This will import the private key with the label "testing" without rescanning the wallet.
